sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react'
import {Container, Text, View, Image} from '../../atoms'
import {Navigation} from '../../molecules'

const Hero = ({title, subtitle, img}) => {
    const [items, setItems] = useState([
        {
            "title": "IN",
            "url": "https://www.linkedin.com/in/ahroidlife/"
        },
        {
            "title": "IG",
            "url": "https://www.instagram.com/user.ahroidlife/"
        },
        {
            "title": "FB",
            "url": "/"
        }
    ])

    return (
        <>
            <Container 
            isEqualWidth="100%" 
            isEqualHeight="100vh" 
            justifyContent="center"
            alignItems="center"
            padding="0px 100px 0px 100px">
                <View height="100%" flexValue="1" direction="column" >
                    <View flexValue="1" direction="column" align="flex-start" padding="150px 0px 0px 0px">
                        <Text family="daily" size="32" width="100px">{title}</Text>
                        <Text margin="50px 0px 0px 0px" width="45%">{subtitle}</Text>
                        <Navigation items={items} padding="0px"/>
                    </View>
                    <View flexValue="1">
                        <Text>Continue</Text>
                    </View>
                </View>
                <View flexValue="1">
                    <Image draggable="false" src={img} />
                </View>
            </Container>
        </>
    )
}

export default Hero
